mdRecord.dcterms:title: Lane High School in Charlottesville reopens
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In September 1958, Gov. J. Lindsay Almond Jr. ordered Lane High School to close after a US District Judge decided that 10 black students suing for admittance should be allowed to attend high school there. Four months later in January 1959, when the Virginia Supreme Court struck down many of the Virginia General Assembly's anti-integration Massive Resistance laws, the high school reopened. Black students began attending classes at Lane beginning the next school year in September 1959. In the clip, two students say they will attend private schools in the next school year rather than attend an integrated high school.Ã‚
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: School integration
Civil rights
